How do Urban Kenyans Consume Media?

WhatsApp

Across the board, respondents most widely referenced using WhatsApp Groups to monitor and share news with friends, colleagues, and family.

Radio &

Newspapers

Respondents of a variety of ages and socioeconomic statuses referenced using radio and newspapers to cross-reference news they read online.

Television

Older respondents, and those with lower socioeconomic statuses, seemed to consume more TV—while young respondents largely avoided programmed TV, choosing YouTube or other internet-first providers.

Web

Browsing

Respondents mostly browsed online using mobile phones, either through a search bar on their device’s home screen or through lightweight applications.

Facebook

& Twitter

Generally, Facebook use is more common than Twitter, but respondents with an interest in media cited Twitter as useful for finding and sharing news with the “right people.”
